definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He frowns upon things like that .
sentences.chinese: 他對那樣的事情是皺眉頭的。

sentences.english: Rebete, frowning at a puddle on a sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 他對着人行道上的一攤“水”直皺眉頭。

sentences.english: The drowsy browser knits its brows to browbeat the frowzy crow.
sentences.chinese: 昏昏欲睡的喫草動物皺眉頭恐嚇邋遢的烏鴉。

sentences.english: The teacher grimaced as he looked at my work.
sentences.chinese: 教師看着我的作業時皺了皺眉頭。

sentences.english: I put a fake frown on my face.
And I think that a lot of Kenyan mothers as well would frown upon hearing that someone had a tattoo.
sentences.chinese: 而且我想，很多肯尼亞母親聽說誰紋了身都會皺眉頭。

sentences.english: The teacher frowned at the noisy class.
sentences.chinese: 老師對吵鬧的全班學生皺眉頭。

sentences.english: At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man began to frown.
sentences.chinese: 黎明時在草坪上，打欠伸的溺水者開端皺眉頭。

sentences.english: He contracted his brows and swallowed medicine down.
sentences.chinese: 他皺了皺眉頭，然後一口把藥水喝了下去。

sentences.english: Silently she frowned with a look of utter distaste.
sentences.chinese: 她沉默着皺一皺眉頭，露出一股極爲憎厭的神情。

sentences.english: they can only furrow their brows at it.
Don't frown. You never know who is fulling in love with your smile.
sentences.chinese: 別皺眉頭，因爲你還不知道誰正愛上了你的微笑。

sentences.english: I don't frown when I do that.
sentences.chinese: 我集中精神的時候不會皺眉頭。

sentences.english: At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man begin to frown.
sentences.chinese: 拂曉時在草坪上，打呵欠的溺水者開端皺眉頭。

sentences.english: He frowned, and getting up, went over to the bookcase and took out a volume at hazard .
sentences.chinese: 他皺皺眉頭，站起身來，走到書架邊隨手抽了一本書。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to relax with one's eyes closed
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
